subject: Technology
title: Conductors and Insulators
description: A 60-second lesson on Conductors and Insulators.

hook.text: Copper lets electricity flow freely. Rubber stops it dead. The difference saves your life every day.

buildup.text: Conductors have electrons that move easily. Metals like copper, gold, and aluminum are excellent conductors.

discovery.text: Insulators grip their electrons tightly. Rubber, glass, and plastic block electricity from passing through.

twist.text: Semiconductors like silicon conduct sometimes and insulate sometimes. This dual nature makes all modern electronics possible.

climax.text: Every wire has a conductor inside and insulator outside. Without both, electricity would be uncontrollable and deadly.

punchline.text: Conductors carry power. Insulators keep you alive. Semiconductors run the world.

quiz.question: What makes semiconductors special?
options: They can both conduct and insulate depending on conditions
They are completely immune to electricity
